subtitle: A perfectly roasted leg of lamb makes a magnificent centre-piece, while being relatively easy to cook. This is great for Sunday lunches with all the family.

method.text: In a bowl, crush two of the garlic cloves with the seasoning, until smooth. Stir in the chopped rosemary and parsley.
Using a sharp, small, pointed knife, make a few evenly spaced incisions into the flesh of the lamb. Open each incision up and spoon in a little of the garlic and herb paste, until all is used up.
Place the joint on a wire rack over a large roasting tin. Brush over the olive oil. Cover and chill for 1 hour.
Stud the remaining garlic cloves and rosemary sprigs into the lamb. Cook in oven for 15 min.
Reduce temperature to 190°C. Cook for 1 hour for medium cooked meat, or 1 hour 30 min for well done meat, basting the leg frequently with the pan juices.
Transfer the lamb to a warmed serving dish. Cover and leave to rest in a warm place for 30 min before serving.

title: Roast lamb
